book_title: Machines that Learn: A Cheesy Guide to Machine Learning
subtitle: From Beginner to Expert in 500 Pages

chapters.chapter_description: Introducing the fundamental concepts of machine learning, its importance and how it has revolutionized the world of technology today.

subchapters.subchapter_description: Defining machine learning and how it differs from traditional programming.
Discussing the three major types of machine learning: Supervised, Unsupervised and Reinforcement.

chapters.chapter_description: The first step in any machine learning project is data preparation. This chapter focuses on data cleaning, pre-processing and preparing your data for machine learning algorithms.

subchapters.subchapter_description: Different ways to collecting data e.g Web Scraping, APIs
Removing inconsistencies, errors, and inaccuracies from your data.
Preparing data for machine learning algorithms
Different data visualization tools that helps to understand and insights from the input data

chapters.chapter_description: This chapter is focused on the most popular type of machine learning, Supervised Learning. Learn how to train and test supervised learning models with real world examples.

subchapters.subchapter_description: A type of regression analysis that models the relationship between independent variables and dependent variables
Predicts the probability of occurrence of an event by fitting data to a logit function
Hierarchical tree structures used to model decisions and their possible consequences
Ensemble learning method for classification, regression and other tasks using a multiple decision trees
Linear and non-linear models for classification and regression analysis
Collection of artificial neurons that work together to solve complex problems

chapters.chapter_description: This chapter is focused on the second major type of machine learning, Unsupervised Learning. Learn how to train and test unsupervised learning models with real world examples.

subchapters.subchapter_description: Partitioning method that attempts to divide a group of observations into K partitional clusters
Method of cluster analysis that builds a hierarchy of clusters from small individual clusters.
Clusters data points based the density of the data points in a region or area
Linear transformation technique used to identify patterns in data and compress the data
Detecting outliers or data points outside the normal data distribution
Discovering patterns or associations in data, particularly transaction data in relational databases

chapters.chapter_description: This chapter is focused on the most advanced type of machine learning, Deep Learning. Learn how to build, train and test multi-layered neural network models with real world examples.

subchapters.subchapter_description: Multilayer perceptron is a feedforward neural network used for classification and regression
Specialized neural networks designed to recognize visual imagery such as images and videos
Designed to recognize patterns in sequences of data such as time series
Special type of RNN model capable of learning long-term dependencies in data
